newsitem.title: FRANCE: CYCLING-TRAVERSONI WINS STAGE AFTER DISQUALIFICATIONS.
newsitem.headline: CYCLING-TRAVERSONI WINS STAGE AFTER DISQUALIFICATIONS.

text.p: Mario Traversoni of Italy won Friday's 19th stage of the Tour de France after the first two riders home were disqualified for infringements.
Dutchman Bart Voskamp and Jens Heppner of Germany cut across each other over the final metres in a two-man sprint to the finish line in the 172-km stage from Montbeliard.
"Both riders committed faults and are disqualified. The win goes to the third (man) over the line," a spokesman for the race jury said.
Voskamp, who staged a breakaway with Heppner from a leading group of 14 some 30 kms from Dijon, went in front near the line.
The Dutchman cut across the German's line when Heppner appeared he was going to overtake. But the German then leant into Voskamp and the pair were shoulder to shoulder as they crossed the line.
Jan Ullrich of Germany retained the overall lead after coming in with the peloton more than 17 minutes behind the sprinters.
